alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 17 at 2:01PM PST until November 19 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SATURDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 7500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 7500 feet. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches with 1 to 2 feet above 8000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph, with ridge top gusts up to 100 mph. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 4 PM Saturday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds may create areas of blowing snow and near zero visibility at times.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
